xyscope

Class XYscope

  • java.lang.Object
    • xyscope.XYscope

  • public class XYscope
extends java.lang.Object
    Render vector graphics on a vector display (oscilloscope X-Y mode, laser) by converting them to audio .

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  XYscope.XYShape 
      class  XYscope.XYShapeList

      • XYscope

        public XYscope(PApplet theParent,
               java.lang.String xyMixer,
               int sampleR)
        Initialize library in setup(), custom soundcard by string for XY and set custom sample rate (44100, 192000).
        Parameters:
        theParent - PApplet to apply to, typically 'this'
        xyMixer - Name of custom sound mixer to use for XY.
        sampleR - Sample rate for soundcard (44100, 48000, 96000, 192000).

        Lists all audio input/output options available

      • waveReset

        public void waveReset()
        Reset time-step used by XYZ oscillators if they slip when changing frequencies.

      • z

        public void z(java.lang.String zMixer)
        Patch z-axis to custom soundcard by String. Note: Auto z-axis has been disabled until solved, until then, one can manually buildZ()
        Parameters:
        zMixer - Name of custom sound mixer to use for Z.

      • z

        public void z(java.lang.String zMixer,
              int sampleR)
        Patch z-axis to custom soundcard by String and set custom sample rate (44100, 192000). Note: Auto z-axis has been disabled until solved, until then, one can manually buildZ()
        Parameters:
        zMixer - Name of custom sound mixer to use for Z.
        sampleR - Sample rate for soundcard (44100, 48000, 192000).

      • zAuto

        public boolean zAuto()
        Check if z-axis waveform is being automatically drawn from added shapes.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • zAuto

        public void zAuto(boolean zAutoBool)
        Enabled by default for automatic generation of z-axis waveform based on added shapes. Disable if creating your own waveform (used for blanking, dotted line, etc. Note: Only works if using a second audio output channel
        Parameters:
        zAutoBool - true/false for generating z waveform

      • wavePoints

        public java.util.ArrayList<PVector> wavePoints()
        Get ArrayList of all coordinates used for vector drawing as an ArrayList of PVector's.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of PVector

      • zRange

        public float[] zRange()
        Get min and max values for z-axis output as two value array.
        Returns:
        array containing [zaxisMin, zaxisMax]

      • zRange

        public void zRange(float zMin,
                   float zMax)
        Set min and max values for z-axis output. Necessary for any inverted z-axis devices.

        default is zMin: 1, zMax: -1

        Parameters:
        zMin - float between -1 to 1
        zMax - float between -1 to 1

      • vectrex

        public void vectrex()
        Use XYscope on a modded Vectrex monitor for XYZ input. This will automatically adjust the canvas and amplitude settings to match the ratio of the Vectrex.

      • vectrex

        public void vectrex(int vrot)
        Use XYscope on a modded Vectrex monitor for XYZ input. This will automatically adjust the canvas and amplitude settings to match the ratio of the Vectrex. You can customize the rotation of the monitor +/- 90° if landscape oriented.
        Parameters:
        vrot - int for degrees of rotation, 90 or -90

      • vectrex

        public void vectrex(int vw,
                    int vh,
                    float vamp,
                    int vrot)
        Use XYscope on a modded Vectrex monitor for XYZ input. Set custom width, height, initial amplitude scaling and rotation/orientation.
        Parameters:
        vw - int for width of canvas, default is 330
        vh - int for height of canvas, default is 410
        vamp - float for initial amplitude adjustment of signal to screen (0.0 - 1.0), default is .6
        vrot - int for degrees of rotation, 90 or -90, default is 0

      • vectrexRatio

        public float vectrexRatio()
        Get current amplitude difference used for ratio of Vectrex.
        Returns:
        float

      • vectrexRatio

        public void vectrexRatio(float vectrexAmpVal)
        Set current amplitude difference used for ratio of Vectrex.
        Parameters:
        vectrexAmpVal - float for amplitude difference (0.0 - 1.0), default is .82

        public void laser(java.lang.String inR,
                  java.lang.String inBG)

        Parameters:
        inR - String for name of audio channel for Red
        inBG - String for name of audio channel for Blue/Green

        public int waveSize()
        Get size of wavetables. By default, it's the same as the outXY.bufferSize()
        Returns:

        public void waveSize(int newSize)

        Parameters:
        newSize - int

      • clearWaves

        public void clearWaves()
        Clears the waveforms from previous buildWaves(). Useful to call at top of draw(), similar to using background() to clear the slate before building the waveforms at the bottom of your draw with buildWaves().

      • buildWaves

        public void buildWaves(int bwm)
        Generate the XY oscillator waveforms from all added shapes for sending audio to vector display. Call this after drawing any primitive shapes. New Rendering mode in place, if old dots style is preferred, use buildWaves(-1).
        Parameters:
        bwm - int for buildWaves mode

      • buildWaves

        public void buildWaves()
        Generate the XY(Z) oscillator waveforms from all added points/shapes for sending audio to vector display. Call this after drawing any primitive shapes.

      • buildX

        public void buildX(float[] newWave)
        Build custom X oscillator waveform. Use waveSize() to ensure you send the right number of values.
        Parameters:
        newWave - Array of normalized floats between 0.0 - 1.0
        See Also:
        waveSize()

      • buildY

        public void buildY(float[] newWave)
        Build custom Y oscillator waveform. Use waveSize() to ensure you send the right number of values.
        Parameters:
        newWave - Array of normalized floats between 0.0 - 1.0
        See Also:
        waveSize()

      • buildZ

        public void buildZ(float[] newWave)
        Build custom Z oscillator waveform. Use waveSize() to ensure you send the right number of values.
        Parameters:
        newWave - Array of normalized floats between 0.0 - 1.0
        See Also:
        waveSize()

      • smoothWaves

        public boolean smoothWaves()
        Check if waveform smoothing is enabled/disabled.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • smoothWaves

        public void smoothWaves(boolean smoothWavesBool)
        Enable/disable Smooth waveforms to reduce visibility of points in drawing. Default is false (new rendering doesn't need it).
        Parameters:
        smoothWavesBool - true/false

      • smoothWavesAmount

        public int smoothWavesAmount()
        Get number of steps for smoothing waveforms.
        Returns:
        int
        See Also:
        Minim » Wavetable » smooth()

      • smoothWavesAmount

        public void smoothWavesAmount(int swAmount)
        Set number of steps for smoothing waveforms. Default is 12.
        Parameters:
        swAmount - new int value for smoothening waveform
        See Also:
        Minim » Wavetable » smooth()

      • drawAll

        public void drawAll()
        Draw all information
        • drawPath()
        • drawWaveform()
        • drawWave()
        • drawXY()
        • drawPoints()

      • drawPath

        public void drawPath()
        Draw path of points remapped from normalized values to width + height of sketch.

      • drawPoints

        public void drawPoints()
        Draw points (as 3px ellipses) remapped from normalized values to width + height of sketch.

      • drawXY

        public void drawXY()
        Simulate X-Y mode of oscilloscope output.

      • drawWaveform

        public void drawWaveform()
        Draw waveform of all XYZ oscillators.
        • Red: X
        • Blue: Y
        • Green: Z

      • drawRGB

        public void drawRGB()
        Draw waveform of all laser RGB oscillators.
        • Red: R
        • Green: G
        • Blue: B

      • drawWave

        public void drawWave()
        Draw wave of all XYZ oscillators.

        int
